title: can i have some help
body:
Can anyone help me get out of bronze. because i hate playing in bronze where everyone rages, trolls and AFKs, i want to play some good games were people don't always purposely feed, if anyone can help or give me advice please help me, i'm bronze II and i'm usually really good in normals but i don't do that many ranked games due to the trollers.
                thanks

replies.body:
Getting out of Bronze is simple, just learn the basics of the game. I'm not even joking, you will instantly start carrying harder just by practicing game basics like CSing, correct trading and vision control. Get into some custom games and practice CSing until you can CS nearly perfectly.

http://i.imgur.com/orWUCKH.jpg

Use that graphic as your method of practicing. As the graphic notes, getting an extra 75 CS (the amount of CS that bronze players often miss by 20 minutes) is like getting FIVE extra kills.

Also, learn how to support. It's not hard to learn, but nobody in Bronze does it correctly. If you do it correctly, you don't even need to carry - the very fact that your team has a proper support boosts your team's power allowing you to have a better chance of winning the game. You don't have to support every game, but there will ALWAYS be games you'll be forced to support, so if you're going to have to support may as well know how to do it correctly. Watch videos for tips but the main things are to learn to trade correctly in lane and how to control vision and time objectives.

You don't need cs to win. I used to play support and get no cs and I still won.

Oh I agree, I'm actually a HUGE proponent of playing support in low Elo. People in low and high Elo are under the misconception that you need to carry a game to win it (or to push the "chances of winning" above 50% by any decent margin). This is, in my opinion, completely false. 

If you'd actually read the bottom of my comment,  you'll see that I said "learn how to support." That said, even supports need to know how to CS. There will be times when you are alone in lane (e.g. defending your tower when your ADC goes back, or you've already warded and you have no opportunities to help someone in the mid game). Being able to CS correctly (with no damage items) can get you your next support item MINUTES earlier than you would have if you suck at CSing.
